Java EE Trainer Job at Campus Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Campus Technologies is an experienced Company in the ICT industry with a major in IT training/education, IT solutions Development & Services, e-Learning Solution Development, and implementation among other businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Java EE Trainer
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic Full-Time Java EE Trainer with expertise in JSF (Java Server Faces), Hibernate, and Spring Framework to conduct hands-on training sessions and mentor students.
	The ideal candidate should have strong enterprise Java development experience and a passion for teaching and guiding students through real-world projects.
	This role is perfect for professionals looking for a flexible schedule while sharing their industry expertise with aspiring developers.


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver interactive and hands-on training in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.
	Guide students through Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Security, Hibernate ORM, and RESTful Web Services.
	Teach enterprise application architecture, design patterns, and database integration techniques.
	Assist students in developing, debugging, and deploying Java EE applications.
	Provide one-on-one mentorship to students, assisting with code debugging, optimization, and real-world implementation challenges.
	Guide students in building industry-standard Java EE applications.
	Offer feedback on student projects and assess their progress.
	Update course materials, lesson plans, and coding exercises as needed.
	Stay up to date with emerging Java EE trends, microservices, and cloud-based architectures.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's or Higher Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	Strong Java EE development experience, with expertise in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.
	Proficiency in Spring Boot, Spring Security, Microservices Architecture, and RESTful APIs.
	Experience with SQL, ORM frameworks, and database integration (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.).
	Familiarity with DevOps tools, CI/CD pipelines, and Agile development methodologies is a plus.
	Strong communication, mentorship, and presentation skills.
	Prior teaching or training experience is preferred.
	Applicant must be at least 30 years old and must reside in Abuja.


Why Join Us?


	Competitive salary and benefits for full-time trainers
	Clear opportunities for career growth and professional certifications
	A dynamic and innovative work environment that encourages creativity
	Hands-on experience with real-world projects and industry tools
	The opportunity to mentor, train, and shape the next generation of Java EE developers
	A supportive team culture that values excellence and continuous learning


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@campustechng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only candidates who meet the requirements will be contacted for the next stage of the selection process. We look forward to having passionate and skilled professionals join our team!.
	If you are passionate about sharing your Java EE and Mobile App Development knowledge and guiding aspiring developers in the enterprise space, we encourage you to apply. Join us in preparing the next generation of IT professionals.

title: Job Vacancies at Lington & Bernie Consulting Limited
content:
Lington & Bernie Consulting Limited was established on October 8, 1999 to provide efficient and qualitative consulting services to the oil and gas industry as well as banks and financial institutions in the areas of human resources placement and management, human resources consulting services, tax administration and payroll services as well as oil and gas fiscal and contractual terms advisory services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Fibre Field Technician

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a skilled Fiber Field Technician who will be responsible for the installation, splicing, testing, maintenance, and repair of fiber optic cables and related infrastructure.
	The role involves supporting network rollouts, troubleshooting connectivity issues, ensuring service quality, and providing on-site technical support to customers and internal teams.


Responsibilities


	Install, splice, terminate, and test fiber optic cables for backbone, access, and last-mile connections.
	Perform aerial and underground fiber installation in compliance with safety standards.
	Carry out customer premises equipment (CPE) installation and ensure proper connectivity.
	Diagnose and repair fiber cuts, faults, and service interruptions.
	Conduct OTDR, power meter, and light source testing for link verification.
	Provide timely resolution of service-affecting issues and escalate complex faults when necessary.
	Support NOC and optimization teams in maintaining network uptime and performance.
	Assist in planned maintenance activities such as link upgrades, re-routing, and preventive maintenance.
	Document and update network records, splicing diagrams, and test results.
	Interact with customers during installation and fault resolution, ensuring professionalism and customer satisfaction.
	Educate customers on proper use and care of installed services.
	Adhere to company safety standards and regulatory requirements during field operations.
	Ensure proper use of tools, vehicles, and protective equipment.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Telecommunications, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
	Minimum 2 – 3 years of hands-on experience in fiber optic installation and maintenance (preferably in an ISP or telecom environment).
	Key Competencies:
	Proficiency with OTDR, power meters, splicing machines, and other fiber testing tools.
	Strong knowledge of fiber cable construction, termination, and splicing techniques.
	Understanding of GPON, FTTH, Metro Fiber, and backbone infrastructure.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in challenging environments.
	Willingness to work flexible hours (weekends, and holidays if needed).


Application Closing Date: 15th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: oluwaseyi.oloidi@lingtonandbernie.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A dynamic and reliable Electrical Technician who will join our team for a large-scale power project involving transformers.
	This role will involve supervising the installation, maintenance, and repair of power transformers, as well as other electrical equipment within the power grid.


Responsibilities


	Oversee the installation of power transformers and associated equipment.
	Ensure routine inspections and testing of transformers.
	Monitor the functionality of BTS.
	Prepare a quotation for the installation of transformer and connection to the national grid and repairs.
	Troubleshoot and diagnose electrical faults.
	Operate and monitor power substation equipment, including transformers.
	Maintain detailed records of work performed and the condition of equipment.
	Ensure adherence to safety regulations and procedures.
	Collaborate with other team members to achieve project goals.
	Oversee the installation and loading of the Prepaid meter with token purchased on behalf of clients.
	Reconciliation of Electric prepaid meter bills and of PPM on sites.
	Have records of all prepaid meter numbers and a time record of when prepaid meters were installed.
	Ensure compliance with the Fiberhub clients using our internet services.


Requirements
Key Attributes and Competencies


	Bachelor's Degree or HND qualification in Electrical Engineering or related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in electrical work and power projects.
	Strong understanding of transformer operation and maintenance.
	Experienced in grid installation and project knowledge.
	Knowledge of relevant safety regulations and standards.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.


Application Closing Date: 15th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: oluwaseyi.oloidi@lingtonandbernie.com using “Electrical Engineer” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Direct Sales Agent

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	As a Direct Sales Agent, you will be responsible for promoting and selling our products directly to customers.
	This role involves building and maintaining strong customer relationships, meeting sales targets, and contributing to the company's overall growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct direct sales presentations to potential customers.
	Build and maintain relationships with clients through effective communication.
	Achieve and exceed individual and team sales targets.
	Provide product knowledge and information to customers.
	Stay informed about market trends and competitor activities. Qualifications •
	Previous experience in direct sales is preferred but not required.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Basic understanding of the company and our products/services.


Requirements


	HND and BSc (Third class is not acceptable)
	The interested candidates must reside in Lagos State
	Interested candidates must not be older than 35.


Application Closing Date: 1st Dec, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidats should send their CV to: jobs@lingtonandbernie.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply
